title: Ingmar Visser
text:
Foto Sander Nieuwenhuys


I am an associate professor working in Developmental Psychology (in the Department of Psychology, Faculty of Social and Behavioral Sciences) at the University of Amsterdam.
Useful links

Babylab Amsterdam: my lab for infant research.
Manybabies: an organisation for collaborative infant research; I participate in a number of projects and lead one of them - Manybabies 3, studying rule-learning.
ManyManys: an organisation for collaborative comparative cognition research; I am one of the initiators of this and member of the advisory board.
College of psychology: I am the director this institute, responsible for the bachelor program.

title: Moving my website to github
text:
After using Wordpress for the longest time I decided it was time to move my website to github with the main advantage that it will be much easier to include R code on webpages and in blog posts such as below. I mostly followed these sites when setting up:

https://quarto.org/docs/websites/
https://samanthacsik.github.io/posts/2022-10-24-quarto-blogs/


1 + 1

[1] 2

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog, trying to set this up. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Moving my website to github
text:
After using Wordpress for the longest time I decided it was time to move my website to quarto & github with the main advantage that it will be much easier to include R code on webpages and in blog posts such as below. Moreover, integration with github will make maintenance much easier. If you want to have a go, I mostly followed these sites when setting up:

https://quarto.org/docs/websites/
https://samanthacsik.github.io/posts/2022-10-24-quarto-blogs/


1 + 1

[1] 2

title: papers
text:
Most of my publications can be found at Google scholar and downloaded from there. Below lists starts with work in progress; let me know if you want more information about those projects.

Work in progress
Exner, Anna, Roberta Bettoni, Chiara Cantiani, Ada Koleini, Catia Margarida Oliveira, Abbie Thompson, Ingmar Visser, and Martin Zettersten (2024). The relationship between rule learning in infancy (5-12 months) and language skills at 24-30 months.
Martina Zaharieva Ingmar Visser, Cristina Collonesi et al (2024a). Endogenous Attention, Emotion Regulation, Feeding, and Sleep in 3- to 13-Month-Old Infants. in preparation.
Martina Zaharieva Ingmar Visser, Cristina Collonesi et al (2024b). Growing emotion and attention regulation: a toolbox for studying self-regulation in infancy. in preparation.
Speekenbrink, Maarten and Ingmar Visser (2024). Ignorable and non-ignorable missing data in hidden Markov models. in revision for Psychometrika.
Exner, Anna, Julien Mayor, David Moreau, Catia Margarida Oliveira, Melanie Soderstrom, Tibor Tauzin, Ingmar Visser, Ivonne Weyers, and Martin Zettersten (2023). Assessing test-retest reliability of rule learning measures in infants. https://doi.org/10.17605/OSF.IO/MA8Z5.
Franse, Rooske, Tessa JP van Schijndel, Ingmar Visser, and Maartje Raijmakers (2023). Children’s understanding of floating and sinking: Predictions and explanations tell different stories. in preparation.
Kosie, Jessica, Martin Zettersten, Rana Abu-Zhaya, Dima Amso, Mireille Babineau, Heidi Baumgartne, Margherita Belia, Silvia Benavides, Christina Bergmann, Ilaria Berteletti, and others (2023). ManyBabies 5: A large-scale investigation of the proposed shift from familiarity preference to novelty preference in infant looking time. Stage 1 registered report under review.
Sarafoglou, Alexandra, Jakub Szymanik, Henrik R Godmann, Ingmar Visser, and Julia M Haaf (2023). Bayesian Hierarchical Models for Meaning Representation. article in preparation.
Schaaf, Jessica, Hilde Huizenga, Ingmar Visser, and Marieke Jepma (2023). Context valence affects learning mechanisms and confidence, but not learning, in adolescents.
Simon Kucharsky Maartje Raijmakers, Ingmar Visser (2023). Strategy classification in economic games using eye-movement data. in preparation.
Zaharieva, Martina, Simon Kucharsky et al, and Ingmar Visser (2023). Habituation, Part I. Design Choices in the Infant Habituation Paradigm: A Pre-registered Crowd-Sourced Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis. Accepted as stage 1 registered report at Infant and Child Development.
Graaff; L.W. Ernest, Sanne C. Maat; Kelly M.A. Dreuning; Siem J.I.P. Janssen; Ingmar Visser; Sabine Hunnius; Markus F. Stevens; Jurgen C. de (2022). Protocol of a prospective case-control pilot-study to assess the relation between General Anesthesia exposure and neurodevelopmental outcome in Pediatrics: the GAP-trial. in preparation.
Visser, Ingmar, Andreea Geambasu, Heidi Baumgartner, Christina Bergmann, Krista Byers-Heinlein, Alex Carstensen, Frances L Doyle, Judit Gervain, Erin Hannon, Naomi Havron, and others (2022). Many babies 3 rule learning-Stage 1 Registered Report-In principle acceptance. Received In Principle Acceptance, data collection in progress.
Lucca, Kelsey, Arthur Capelier-Mourguy, Laura Cirelli, Krista Byers-Heinlein, Rodrigo Dal Ben, Michael C Frank, Annette ME Henderson, Jonathan F Kominsky, Zoe Liberman, Francesco Margoni, and others (2021). Infants’ Social Evaluation of Helpers and Hinderers: A Large-Scale, Multi-Lab, Coordinated Replication Study. contributed data collection to this ManyBabies 4 study, in preparation.
Schuwerk, Tobias, Dora Kampis, Renée Baillargeon, Szilvia Biro, Manuel Bohn, Krista Byers-Heinlein, Sebastian Dörrenberg, Cynthia Fisher, Laura Franchin, Tess Fulcher, and others (2021). Action anticipation based on an agent’s epistemic state in toddlers and adults. contributed data collection to this ManyBabies 2 study, in preparation.
Kucharsk` y, Šimon, Bobby Lee Houtkoop, and Ingmar Visser (2020). Code Sharing in Psychological Methods and Statistics: An Overview and Associations with Conventional and Alternative Research Metrics.
